Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve cleanliness and smoke smell”
Reviews.Author: patsgo
Reviews.Content: Arrived for checking to find no front desk agent, but a sign advising someone would be right back. After a few minutes, the clerk appeared and checked us in. The room itself was okay, with slightly older furnishings then other Homewood suites. The living room couch was uncomfortable and there was an aluminum "box" situated in front of the couch vs. a table. We found a piece of candy on the bedroom floor and long dark hair on the comforter in the closet. Housekeeping delivered a fresh comforter upon request. The biggest issue was we were in a non-smoking room and awoke one morning to the strong smell of cigarette smoke. It seemed to be coming from the bathroom vent. Thankfully we were checking out that morning. When we were leaving in the morning, once again there were no front desk agents to advise of our issues. Subsequently, a letter to customer service was sent detailing the issues. On the plus side, the towels in the room were very soft and the breakfast was good. The pool was small, but the area was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Sion-33126
Reviews.Content: Free breakfast, free dinner buffet, free wi fi, free

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found it.”
Reviews.Author: melaniegm
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for a week at a different hotel that we found unacceptable at check-in. We decided to take a chance on Homewood Suites and were we ever glad we did! Even though it was more expensive, it was relatively afforadable and because of the the incuded meals (full breakfast everyday and dinner four nights of the week) actually turned out to be a good value. Our two room suite was spacious and beautiful and clean and even though all they had was a smoking room, we were very happy with it. The staff was wonderful, refilling our wine galsses at dinner, (yes, wine and beer served with dinner) and promptly fixing a minor problem with the room.

Reviews.Title: “It worked perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Concord_Kids
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I drove in from Ohio on our journey west. The hotel was everything people had said in their reviews. It was easy to find and a great location for our evening plans. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The suite was spacious, well-appointed, and very clean. Temperature control (one of my pet peeves in hotels) was great. We went out for dinner with friends so I can't speak about the evening meal. Breakfast was excellent with hot and cold choices. All in all, it was a great satay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the time to find”
Reviews.Author: studlyIllinois
Reviews.Content: What an awesome hotel. It is worth it to go around 465 to this hotel. It is on a quiet side street, semi-secluded, and was worth the time it took to get there. What a great place. The room was so clean, we slept like babies in the huge king bed. The room was quiet and comfortable. A great find after the long travel week we'd had. We would stay at this hotel any time we were in or going through Indianapolis. The bonus was there is a new Cracker Barrel in the same parking lot. Really nice. PS: The laundry room is on the fourth floor, not the third as we were told.

Reviews.Title: “A step above the rest!”
Reviews.Author: LARRYANDSALLY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites recently while visiting Indianapolis. The hotel was above and beyond our expectations. The decorating is tastefully done. The room we rented was a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite and it worked out great. The two bedrooms are separated by a living area and kitchen so they are very quiet and private. The beds have pillow-top mattresses and they were very comfortable. The walk-in shower was great. We enjoyed the continental breakfast the next morning and the hotel staff treated us very well. We highly recommend this hotel. The only downside is the location is a little off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay at!!”
Reviews.Author: kristina w
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with a king size bed and full kitchen which was nice having a 2 year old. The pool was indoor, small, but very nice and well kept. My daughter loved the pool and the hot tub. Pool towels were fully stocked there in the pool area. Bed in room was so comfortable, they had at least 8 or 9 pillows on the bed. Also had a sleeper sofa and they provided us with a pack-n-play for our daughter. Hotel staff were very friendly and even played with my daughter and talked to her every time we walked by. Best part was the complimentary breakfast! They had a waffle maker with fresh batter, scambled eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, donuts, muffins, bagels, toast, coffee, milk, orange juice. It was one of the nicest buffets. The waffles were the best I have ever had. What a deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zihuatcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel while in the area on business. When I stepped on the elevator, I was a little apprehensive because it was pretty dingy and the carpet was stained and dirty. But once I opened the door to my room, I was instantly relieved. The room was modern and spotlessly clean. I stayed in a king studio suite so the bedroom and living area were all in one big room. There is a kitchenette as you walk in the door and a large bathroom/vanity area off the bedroom. The bed was extremely comfy and the a/c worked like a dream. I also loved having a ceiling fan over the bed just like at home. I had a few minor complaints, mostly to do with the kitchen area. It would be nice if the hotel at least included dish soap and paper towels. Soap for the dishwasher is provided. The cleaning staff would run the dishwasher every day even if the only items in it were a couple of plates and a glass. This seems wasteful. I agree with a previous reviewer that an icemaker would be nice but I just filled up the bin from the ice machine down the hall and that worked just fine. The one thing that bothered me most, however, was the lack of decent sized trash cans in the room. If a kitchenette is provided then it's assumed guests will be cooking. A trash can bigger than 12 inches would be nice. The location of this hotel is convenient, right off the interstate and within short distance of many restaurants. I did not partake of the free breakfast and dinner. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, especially the younger guy who worked evenings. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and have several more upcoming business trips to the area. I will continue to stay at this hotel for each of them.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a fan.”
Reviews.Author: KarenSMichigan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this location several times. Clean. Comfy beds (love the ceiling fan!). Decent breakfast. My husband wakes up much earlier than I do, so we really like having a separate bedroom with a door. I took advantage of the "e-check-in" the day prior to our arrival. What a great feature! When we arrived, I don't think we were at the front desk more than a 2-3 minutes before we had our key and headed for the room. I hope other Hilton locations start using this option. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: nana8fish
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean, the bed comfortable, the breakfast was good, and we liked the two-room suite concept. However, there were some areas that could use improvement. First of all, the couch in the living area was very uncomfortable. The kitchens in Homewoods are usually well-equipped, but this one had a very limited kitchen. There was no skillet and only one very small microwave pan. There were no pots that could be used on the stove. No kitchen soap. No ice maker in the frig. Another place where some changes could be made are in the pool/hot tub area. The Homewood has a very nice pool area, but we never made use of it because the hot tub was always full of little children. At one point they had three plastic chairs floating in it. There needs to be more supervision of that area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: KarenSMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood for one night in February and again over the Fourth of July weekend. Great stay. Decent breakfast although the last morning we decided to walk across the parking lot to the Cracker Barrel. We've stayed at all three Homewood's in Indianapolis on different occasions and all are nice. What I like about this one is it's location and ease of getting to and from the highway. And they have a better rate which is always a plus!

Reviews.Title: “It truly was a home away from home experience.”
Reviews.Author: wizofwoz
Reviews.Content: We had to book a hotel on the north side of Indianapolis because my son was having surgery at the Methodist Sports Medicine hospital. We booked the Homewood Suites because I knew it was like an apartment with a separate bedroom and sitting room plus a full kitchen because I knew we wouldn't be able to eat out after the surgery. But we ended up not needing the kitchen because this hotel provided COMPLIMENTARY breakfast AND dinner (called the manager's reception which is only Mon-Fri). I can't tell you how great it was just to go downstairs to fix a plate for my son while my husband watched over him. And the food was GREAT! For breakfast....name something, they had it. (Try the blueberry scones!) Dinner that night was lasagna, garlic bread and veggies. Salad had plenty of extras and a variety of dressings. They had fresh lemonade....and free beer and wine. It was incredible. What a value! The cost of the room is what you'd pay for any decent hotel with complimentary breakfast so to get two really decent meals and very nice rooms with great beds....well you're not going to get better than this. My husband travels alot for business and has a bad back...so is extremely picky. He was very happy with this hotel. The couch and chair in the sitting room isn't the greatest but the beds are very good, high quality. The rest of the furnishings are beautiful....bathroom is huge, water is hot, lighting and internet are great. A/C runs quiet. Every member of the staff we ran into were friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated the front desk letting us check in early....we had just flown in and were tired. The drive to the airport from this hotel is not bad either because the hotel is right off the freeway exit. Of course you'd never know it while you're inside the hotel because it's so quiet. There was construction going on on 465 S so it slowed us down so it took us about 1/2 hour. But I wouldn't do the drive in rush hour. When we left the hospital to go to the Homewood Suites (which is just a couple miles away from it) it was 5 pm and the traffic was horrendous on that freeway. Also you are across the parking lot from Cracker Barrel which always has great food. Considering the stress of the trip (worrying about my son and his pain), this was a GREAT experience. It was as close you could be to being home....a really nice home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Indy Stopover - Lots of Room and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Reviewer20
Reviews.Content: Traveling through Indiana, and had a morning flight out of IND, so picked this particular property to stay the night. It was - while not really close to the airport - on the way to the airport, and based on the hotel's website, only about 15 - 20 minutes away, all freeway. Plus the midweek rate was pretty good - $98, and that includes breakfast and dinner (only M - Th for dinner). The hotel itself was in pretty good condition - it's right on the corner of the beltway (465) and another busy street, but it was behind another hotel property and the Cracker Barrel next door, so it seemed relatively quiet. Definitely no noise issues. It seemed fairly new, not sure when it was built, but the rooms, hallways, common areas, etc. showed no signs of wear, and things were kept relatively clean throughout the property. One exception was the dining area - it wasn't "dirty" per se, but could have used a bit more attention during the busy eating times - dinner and breakfast. I think they keep it staffed fairly tightly - one or two people running it all, and they did a fantastic job at keeping the food and drink areas well stocked, rotated, and replenished. The table cleanliness is just a nit, didn't detract from the mealtime at all. The breakfast spread was great - plenty of hot and cold items, much much more than typical continental type breakfast spreads. Also nice is the "manager's reception" on M - Th evenings - it's really dinner, but they just have one choice...it's not a buffet. The night I was there, they had hot dogs, macaroni/cheese, and salad, plus free wine/beer if you want. Limited selection notwithstanding, it's a really nice feature - especially if you ever travel with a family. The room was great - typical to Homewood Suites properties, had the bedroom, bathroom, living area, and kitchen with oven, full refrigerator, sink, etc. That's really nice if you are staying for one night or a long time. You can get food at the grocery store, and store it for cooking later. That was really nice, and they have a dishwasher to use, plus the plates and silverware you would need. That's also a great feature. They have the standard hotel fitness center and pool/hot tub areas. The fitness center was pretty small - one treadmill, one bike, one stairstepper, and some free weights. The indoor pool/hot tub area was pretty big - a lot of seating area. Maybe could have made the fitness room a bit bigger, but it definitely served its purpose. I didn't use the business center, but it was the standard one, looked like it had everything you'd need. Something nice was that the hotel had free internet - it's good to see that all properties are moving this way; it used to be just the Hampton Inns that had the free internet, now it seems like most Hilton properties do. The area surrounding the hotel was ok - fairly busy, but consequently there were a ton of restaurants, shopping, grocery, Walgreen's, etc. So I would rate the location as decent for that reason. I'll definitely be back if in the area under similar circumstances (flying out of IND), or if I have meetings in the city. The rate was the clincher - better than most other properties of similar size.

Reviews.Title: “High end experience for great value”
Reviews.Author: MickyDay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends. Lots of room. It was like staying in a small apartment. We had room for relaxing and entertaining. The beds were wonderful. The best night's sleep I've ever had in a hotel. The expressway is right next to the hotel, but we barely heard it. The lobby and common spaces are beautiful. The complimentary breakfast was so nice that we decided to eat at the hotel instead of going out (which we usually do). We had coffee on the patio off the breakfast room. We didn't have time to use the fitness room or the pool, but we checked them out and they look immaculate. It's easy to get to off the expressway and downtown is only a few minutes away. The best part was that for a rate comparable to other chain hotels (most being unremarkable) it felt like we were staying in a higher end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, family-friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: UtahRoadTripper
Reviews.Content: My whole family stayed here for the weekend of my brother's wedding. The suites were large enough to accommodate young families (small children), and the double rooms were comfortable for many adults to get together and visit. We pretty much had the pool to ourselves, and had no problems getting enough breakfast for everyone. Overall, it was a great experience for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: PaceJapan
Reviews.Content: My 2 teens and I spent nearly a week at the Homewood Suites and thought it was a great home away from home. The room was clean and well appointed with full kitchen. The breakfast was tasty as was the manager's reception in the evening. We also made use of the business center to catch up on emails and update our frequent flyer miles. It was nice to have a laundry on site, even if the other people using it were inconsiderate. The location was also very good. We'll stay again the next time we're in town!

Reviews.Title: “Above average accommodations at the Homewood”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Travelers should not have any significant issues with this hotel, especially business travelers. First impressions upon entering the building are positive; nice decor. The common area used for manager receptions and breakfast is also well appointed. Front desk staff was friendly and professional. Hotel was clean and well maintained. My room was excellent (I stayed for two nights). Housekeeping did a great job. Pillows and mattresses were extremely comfortable. Dual zone heating system kept me warm. Showers had ample hot water. The room had everything I expected for a Homewood Suites. Yes, I-465 skirts right by the front of the hotel. For me, the road noise was not bothersome. Late at night there just isn't that much traffic, plus when the heater kicked in, the blower fan muffled any road noise (by the way, the heater noise was normal for such a unit). Ask for a rear room if you think traffic noise would be a problem. Big breakfast fans will be pleased with the neighboring Cracker Barrell restaurant within walking distance. Of course the food offered at Homewood is adequate for most people. This is a nice hotel worthy of your business.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Indianapolis Northwest
HotelInfo.Address: 4140 West 94th Street, Indianapolis, IN 46268
